review_text: We’ve had these for almost two months, so I feel confident to give a review. First off, don’t give this to your kid without trying it on yourself. Melatonin is powerful stuff and must be used thoughtfully. Our conclusions: 1. One whole pill is too much for an adult and most certainly for a child. They will have bad after-effects the day after. 2. On the other hand a fourth of a pill isn’t enough and it caused us all to wake up in the middle of the night abruptly. 3. Half a pill, is just enough to keep a child and an adult asleep through the night without interruptions. 4. However, having even half a pill will make you a bit floaty the day after. It's not bad for a Saturday. But if the kid has an important test I wouldn't give him melatonin the night before. We as adults had some trouble with tasks that required high levels of focus. 5. If we give him melatonin two days in a row, our son wakes up with nightmares. In conclusion, these melatonin gummies are great for getting your kid's sleep on track, but you have to find the right combination for him. We give him half a gummy every two days, about forty-five minutes before bed. Somehow the melatonin lasts for another day or two before we have half to give him another half. No nightmares this way and we keep a relatively steady sleep time. Make sure to try these during the weekend, so you can see the after-effects on your kid. Ours is a very high energy boy, but more than half every two days and he becomes drowsy. Still, I do highly recommend these. They are very worth trial and error.

review_text: I gave these to four of my kids because their sleep was out of whack after the holidays and stress and I thought it was a natural way to get their circadian rhythms back to a better sleep schedule. It definitely helped one of my kids. Two kids didn't really have an affect. But one child had a very adverse reaction. She started having horrible panic attacks and screaming and running frantically around the house several nights; her heart felt like it was going to explode from her chest. We didn't make the connection until we had used the melatonin for about two weeks. We weren't giving them to the kids every night, maybe every other night or two. We finally realized that these frightening, almost complete personality changes were only happening on the nights after we gave her melatonin before she got into bed. We stopped giving them the gummies and she has not had a repeat of the panic attacks or any of the crazy behavior. Researching more deeply after the fact, I have learned that there is very little research on the effects of melatonin, especially in children. It is not FDA approved. And what little research there is recommends that melatonin should only be used short term. Melatonin amount can vary from one gummy/pill to the next, even within the same bottle. There are no standards for what amounts of melatonin are effective for what sized bodies. And... some people have an adverse and opposite reaction of anxiety. So please do your research and use caution when using. Observe your kids and if you see me troubling behavior after they take melatonin, it could be related.
